The Elder Nimittasaññaka’s Birth Story
“On the bank of the Candabhāgā River,
I lived in a secluded place;
I saw a golden deer,
Roaming in the wilderness.
Having gladdened my mind with the deer,
I recollected the world’s foremost one;
By that gladdened mind,

original: aññe buddhe anussariṁ.🔽Abbhatītā ca ye buddhā,
analyzed: aññe buddhe anussari  ca ye buddhā
translated: I recollected other Buddhas.🔽The Buddhas of the past,
The Buddhas of the present, and the future;
Just so do they shine,
Like those three deer kings.
For ninety-four eons,
I attained that perception then;
I do not know of a bad destination,
This is the fruit of perceiving the Buddha.
Twenty-seven eons ago,
There was a lord of the earth;
Named Araññasattha,
A powerful wheel-turning monarch.
The four analytical knowledges,
The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā nimittasaññako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā nimittasaññakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus have I heard. The Elder Nimittasaññaka recited these verses.
The Elder Nimittasaññaka’s Birth Story, the fifth.
